Title.evidence: Advanced Cryotherapy vs. Cold Packs in Knee Arthroplasty: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: randomly assigned to receive advanced cryotherapy (n=58) or cold packs (n=58). A priori sample size calculation indicated 50 subjects per group were needed to detect a 2-point VAS difference with 80% power.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included adults undergoing primary knee arthroplasty. Conducted at a single orthopedic center

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to receive advanced cryotherapy (n=58) or cold packs (n=58)

Objective.evidence: aimed to assess the impact of advanced cryotherapy devices versus cold packs on recovery following knee arthroplasty.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was postoperative pain, evaluated using the Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) and analgesic consumption over 6 weeks.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 116 patients scheduled for knee arthroplasty were randomly assigned

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant differences were found in VAS scores or analgesic use between groups. The advanced cryotherapy group exhibited reduced flexion at 6 weeks (114° vs. 120°).

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding information were not disclosed.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding information were not disclosed.
